alert.note: Alert for Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 19 at 2:31PM AKST until January 21 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT AKST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. Winds are expected to decrease Sunday morning, which will allow improvements in conditions. * WHERE...Central Arctic Plains and Central Brooks Range. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to midnight AKST Saturday night. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Central Arctic Plains; Central Brooks Range
